author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1577627711}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un point & click aux graphismes atypiques. Il se finit tr√®s rapidement et est vraiment simple. Pas grand chose √† en dire √† part √ßa !

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

Aucun achievement pour le moment.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Une courte exp√©rience. Si vous avez 15 minutes, c'est pas mal.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai rencontr√© aucun probl√®me.

OS: Linux Mint 19.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1556585132}
review: The game started off with a splash-screen explaining how the game was made with free and open source software. I thought that was very nice, just like this short adventure game. Did not take long to complete this introductory chapter, but it is no-cost and provides insight into the developer's other game on steam. Worth checking this one out. The game uses the Unity game engine, and it takes up 425 MBs of disk space. I used an ubuntu desktop with radeon mesa graphic drivers, and I used a mouse to control all interactions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1553824456}
review:
[h1]Has a huge game-breaking bug that ruins the very puzzle you're supposed to solve[/h1]

This is a short 10-minute point-'n'-click adventure game with a few locations. Your task is to explore, identify a problem that needs to be solved, then solve it.

Unfortunately, there is a gaping, glaring bug that spoils the entire game. 

Read on below if you're ok with spoilers:

[spoiler]You're supposed to get the statue past Barsnick in order to bring it back to the witch. 

The "correct" solution the game wants you to do, is to enter an empty room next to where the Barrel guy is, remove a brick from the wall, and push the statue through it. You're then supposed to go to the tavern and pick up the statue. Then you can bring it back to the witch and the game will end.

However, you don't even need to do that!!! As long as you enter the empty room then exit it (without removing the brick as I mention above), then go back the way you came from (i.e. past Barsnick who's now talking to Marv), the game will allow you to walk past Barsnick without any incident, even with the statue still in your arms!

That's what I actually did. So I made it back to the witch with the statue, but the game would not allow me to give the statue to her, simply because that's not supposed to happen - i.e. you MUST solve the problem via the method I stated earlier, or else the game will not end.

[h1]It's very clear that this is a huge programming oversight[/h1]
Your character shouldn't be allowed to leave the scene with the statue [b][i]unless he's solved the problem of how to get past Barsnick[/i][/b], but [b]yet the game allows you to do so[/b], spoiling the entire puzzle.[/spoiler]

[h1]Also has various other missteps[/h1]

Here are some other sins this game commits that are huge adventure game no-nos:

- If you miss or forget the instructions on what to do next, talking to that same character again will not make them tell you the instructions again, so too bad!
- When your character says something, the dialogue balloon that appears covers the area behind it (so you can't see/click that area), and there's no way to make that balloon disappear unless you click somewhere for your character to walk to.

[h1]A failed effort[/h1]

This could've been a fun experience - the graphics and animation are at least decent and the black-&-white feel works, but I can't get over the fact that such a gargantuan programming oversight was made (that contributes to the bug I mention in the spoiler above), and that simple, basic, commonsensical stuff like having an option to make dialogue boxes disappear so they stop blocking areas of the scene, and allowing conversations to replay in case you miss/forget what to do next, were not taken into consideration in the making of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1552134109}
review:
Font too small. Unreadable.

That's enough to give it a pass. The font type isn't good, but it would be bearable if its size was made for human eyes instead of eagle peepers. Visual cues on the cursor and elsewhere are of the same caliber, making the game essentially a pixel-hunting exercise. Music is an annoying loop, but can be shut off. I like the visual style, but the UI is just awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276548517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1543754391}
review:
Kith - Tales from the Fractured Plateaus est un jeu d'aventure gratuit. 
Il est plaisant √† jouer, et tr√®s simple. Il est vraiment tr√®s court et se finit en moins d'une demi-heure.

Le sc√©nario est assez basique, la musique agr√©able, les graphismes sont originaux rappelant les bandes dessin√©es, compos√©s de d√©cors en 2D et de personnages en 3D, le tout en noir et blanc.
Le jeu se joue uniquement √† la souris, et il n'est pas n√©cessaire d'avoir un bon niveau en anglais pour le finir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031534770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1542363075}
review:
Too short (20 minutes), too linear and too easy point'n click , but it definitely worth to play for the art design, the cute world and the atmosphere.
I hope they will develop this universe, with more flesh, more background and more difficulty. There's some room for less childish approach of this.
It's a nice creation. And it's free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997713639', 'num_games_owned': 2534, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1498747231}
review:
What the I don't even..?

Was just getting into Kith (talking to the inhabitants, learning the lore, etc.) & it abruptly halted - with a big "THE END" notification (& nothing else...)

Enjoyable but shockingly-short F2P point-&-click adventure about, ostensibly, fixing a bridge for the local witch - done by collecting three items from the minuscule locale.

Edit
====
There's a DLC in the works which, hopefully, will expand on the storyline, as it's a sweet little game with a pleasing art style & relaxing (if repetitive) BGM.

Edit #2
=====
Almost three years since my last edit & nothing DLC-related yet. I won't be holding my breath - seems a shame...

author: {'steamid': '76561198024756923', 'num_games_owned': 2845, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1493039016}
review:
A short point and click game with a unique art-style. The puzzles are a bit easy for a point and click veteran but I enjoyed experiencing the different style.

Youtube video of my playthrough: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-6c3URXXGQ

review:
I laughed, a lot. It is cute and funny, and it works. 
Some minor details could be fixed, but I wouldn't add that here in the review, because spoilers. 

I highly recommend it! And am looking forward to the next episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037402613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1491598959}
review:
I've played this first through itch.io and replayed it just now to see if anything was added.  The answer is no.

It is a point-and-click adventure done up with 3D characters in what looks like a graphite isometric map.  There isn't much to speak of for the game yet as it is the first chapter and if I'm quite honest the characters are a bit on the ugly side and the single looping bgm got annoying.  Most of your time, for the first chapter at any rate, will be spend walking from screen to screen.  There may be a few points where you might be confused on what to do but even confused clicking can lead to the solution.

Until more chapters come out I cannot recommend this.  Too short and too simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1491593333}
review: Kith - Tales from the Fractured Plateaus is a pretty cool indie adventure game. Decent exploration and world building I this first episode I though.  It sounds like there may be more to come depending on how this is received. If you are interested or are a fan of old school adventure games Id recommend you give Kith a try.
